result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC >= .02 Under IID Order (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffery Scott Molepske was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay fine of $600 plus costs totaling $1,694.00.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Cash bond posted is to be applied to any fines/costs.
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.  Huber for work and treatment. 
Eligible for Electronic Monitor after serving 1/2 of the sentence but will need to be assessed to determine if eligible by the Portage County Sheriff's Department. 
Jail sentence to commence today. 
Defendant is remanded to the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation
Effective as of today's date (8/25/15) on any vehicles owned, operated or titled in the defendant's name.

records.addlTxt: Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report
for Ignition Interlock Exemptions and Removing Title Transfer Stops /s/TBE 8-25-15 Granted - 80 Ford

Defendant Jeffery Scott Molepske in court with attorney John Thomas Bayer. John Thomas Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF436 and 14TR3780.

1:35 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Brubacher states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14TR3780:
Count 1 - Dismissed

14CF436:
Count 1 - Guilty 
Count 2 - Dismissed
Count 3 - Dismissed
Count 4 - Dismissed

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 and Counts 2-4 are dismissed outright on Case 14CF436 and Count 1 of 14TR3780 is dismissed outright.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Brubacher makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Bayer makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
14TR3780:
Count 1 - Dismissed

14CF436:
Count 1 - 
Pay fine of $600 plus costs totalling $1,694.00
Pay blood draw of $26.45
45 days in Portage County Jail with Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.  Huber for work and treatment.
Eligible for electronic monitor after serving 1/2 of the sentence but will need to be assessed to determine if eligible by the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Jail sentence to commence today
24 month DL revocation, Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation
24 month IID, effective as of today's date on any vehicles owned, operated or titled in the defendant's name
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Cash bond posted to be applied to any fines/costs.
Pay fines/costs within 60 days or set up a payment plan
Defendant to be remanded to the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Court signs the exemption for the Ignition Interlock.

Count 2 - Dismissed
Count 3 - Dismissed
Count 4 - Dismissed
for Temporary Modification of Bail Condition /s/ TBE 08/10/15
from TBE re: Stipulation and Order
Fax requesting withdrawal of Stipulation and Order for Modification of Bond Conditions
Plea hearing at 08-25-2015 01:30 pm
Pre-trial conference at 07-20-2015 09:00 am

Arraignment at 04-02-2015 10:00 am.
Telephone conference at 05-26-2015 10:45 am.
Copy of State v. Tischer 323 Wis 2d 823 (2010)
Telephone conference at 05-26-2015 10:45 am
Telephone conference at 05-26-2015 10:45 am

Defendant Jeffery Scott Molepske in court with attorney John Thomas Bayer. Sidney Allen Brubacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This is set for an arraignment and Motion Hearing.

10:19 a.m.  Exhibit's #1 & #2 marked for Atty Brubacher.
10:21 a.m.  Exhibit #3 marked for Atty Bayer.

10:21 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Brubacher states the appearances.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond Continued.

MOTION HEARING:
10:24 a.m.  Court proceed's to the Motion Hearing (Motion to Suppress) filed by the Attorney for the Defendant.
Atty Bayer consults with his client.
Atty Brubacher would call one witness.
Atty Bayer makes statements regarding playing a squad video, this has been marked as an exhibit and will be viewed by the Court later.
Court does inform Atty Bayer that in this instance he should have contacted the Court and informed of his intentions so that they could have had the equipment required set up.
10:26 a.m.  Deputy Mulrooney sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Brubacher.
Witness identifies the defendant; Atty Brubacher asks that the court indicate that the witness has identified the defendant.  Atty Bayer has no objection.
10:33 a.m.  Exhibit #1 is referenced by Atty Brubacher.
Atty Bayer states that he does not have the preface that was marked as Exhibit #1.  
Atty Mulrooney reads Exhibit #1.
10:35 a.m.  Exhibit #2 is referenced by Atty Brubacher.
Atty Mulrooney reads Exhibit #2 (incorrect page marked for Atty Brubacher).
Atty Bayer provides a copy of the correct information (session 8) and Court does acknowledge that this information has been provided by defense counsel.  Atty Mulrooney now reads the correct information
Atty Brubacher approaches the witness to show Atty Mulrooney a copy of his report.
10:41 a.m.   Atty Brubacher approaches the witness again to refresh his memory by showing Deputy Mulrooney a copy of his report.
10:44 a.m.  Cross examination by Atty Bayer.
Atty Bayer references Exhibit #3 (squad video) and asks that the Court review later.
10:47 a.m.  Both Atty's stiuplate to the admission of Exhibit #3.  Received by the Court.
10:49 a.m.  Atty Bayer approaches the witness to refresh his memory as to the height of the defendant and show's him a copy of the citation.
10:55 a.m.  Exhibit #4 is marked for Atty Bayer and referenced.
11:07 a.m.  Atty Bayer again approaches the witness to show him a copy of the citation to refresh his memory of the weight of the defendant.
11:11 a.m.  Re-direct by Atty Brubacher.
11:12 a.m.  Re-cross by Atty Bayer.
Witness is excused.
11:13 a.m.  Atty Bayer admits exhibit #4; no objection.  Received by the Court.
11:14 a.m.  Atty Brubacher admits exhibit #1 & #2; no objection.  Received by the Court.
11:15 a.m.  Court is in a brief recess for Atty Bayer to consult with his client and for the Court to review exhibit #3.

11:49 a.m.  Court is back in session and appearances remain the same as prior to the recess.
Atty Bayer will not be calling any witnesses.
Atty Bayer states his argument on his motion to suppress.
11:54 a.m.  Court makes statement to Atty Bayer; Atty Bayer responds.
12:05 p.m.  Court makes statements regarding the argument of the PBT by Atty Bayer as it is a non-relevant issue.
12:09 p.m.  Atty Brubacher states his argument.
12:14 p.m.  Court makes a statement regarding the search and the retrieval of the drugs located in the car of the defendant.
Atty Brubacher makes statement in response to the Court's statement.
12:15 p.m.  Atty Bayer has no rebuttal.

BY THE COURT:
Court DENIES Motion to Suppress.
Court finds that there was not sufficient evidence to search and recover the THC - Court GRANTS the suppression of the THC evidence.
Court GRANTS the suppression for the paraphernalia evidence.
Court finds that the blood draw was properly done and denies the motion of the defense.















  Telephone conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Motion hearing on April 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on April 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

from Atty Bayer re: non-appearance at Initial Appearance
Preliminary hearing on January 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jeffery Scott Molepske in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court notes there is a Notice of Retainer in the file for John Bayer. 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of the amended criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the amended complaint.
Defendant indicates he has spoken to his attorney who cannot be here due to inclement weather.  Has been informed to waive the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Makes statements regarding day report being amended to 5 days per week. 
Atty Constable indicates there are no notes in the file.  Asks that the defendant have his attorney contact Attorney Cousins to do a stipulation and order. 
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant will be traveling home in the UP.  

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Atty Mayer
(prior conviction date correction)
Initial appearance on November 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 4th, Possess of THC/Drug Paraphernalia.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant makes additional statements to the Court. 
State requests bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  11/17/2014  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

To post the cash by Monday November 3, 2014 by 4:30 p.m.  
If he fails to pay the $1,200 by Monday November 3, 2014 at 4:30 then he will need to sign a wage assignment with the Clerk of Courts office for $250 per paycheck until the $1,200 is posted.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia unlawfully. 
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

**Per Stipuation and Order - The defendant comply with participation in the pre-trial supervision program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment and programming, be suspended temporarily on the dates of November 26, 2104 - November 30, 2014 and then resume thereafter on December 1, 2014.

***Per Stipulation and Order: That the bail conditions that he comply with participation in the pre-trial supervision program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment and programming be amended to apply only during the business days of Monday - Thursday.*** /s/TBE 12/10/14

****Per Stipulation and Order: That the bail conditions that he comply with participation in the pre-trial supervision program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment and programming be temporarily supsended on the dates of December 24, 2014 - December 26, 2014 and December 31, 2014 - January 2, 2015. ****

*****Per Stipulation and Order: That the bail conditions that he comply with participation in the pre-trial supervision program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment and programming be temporarily supsended on the dates of August 3, 2015 - August 17, 2015.
